detailsOfAchievement: Among its many achievements, Sense International India has 1. Consultative status with United Nations on disability issues 2. Increased the number of deafblind people receiving support from just 23 in 1997 to more than 71,000 today. 3.Developed a network of 57 partners across the country to sustain the movement to support deafblindness. Strengthened this further by a unique mentorship programme and instituting Regional and state learning Centres. 4.Strategically aligned with the Government of India in their flagship- education programme- Sarva Shiksha Abhiyaan SSA for inclusion of deafblind children in its mandate. 5.Facilitated inclusion of deafblindness in Disability Policy of Chhattisgarh state. We are now working in Bihar, Meghalaya and Kerala on similar lines. 6.Designed and initiated a two year diploma course in Special Education on Deafblindness recognised by Rehabilitation Council of India and certified by the National Institute for the Visually Handicapped NIVH. 7.Ensured the incorporation of deafblindness in various training programmes and curriculums such as those of National Institutes NIVH, NIMH, NIEPMD, and AYJNIHH, primary and secondary mainstream school teachers, resource teachers and coordinators working in the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan SSA, educators of single category disability, doctors, Caregivers etc. 8. Facilitated the inclusion of deafblindness into National Trust Act for the Welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation and Multiple Disabilities. 9. Deafblindness is now included under the assistance to disabled persons for Purchase Fitting of Aids & Appliances scheme of Government of India. 10. Our Advocacy Officer Zamir Dhale has been elected as a board member in the prestigious National Trust for the Welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation & Multiple Disabilities Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment Government of India. 11. Contributed as member of drafting committee for the "Rights of People With Disabilities Bill".

detailsOfAchievement: SEWA Rural is a voluntary development organisation involved in health & development activities in rural tribal area of South Gujarat at Jhagadia since 1980. The activities were initiated by a group of young professionals having education & experience in India & abroad and based upon the ideals & ideas of Swami Vivekananda & Gandhiji. Over the years many like minded individuals joined the organisation. SEWA Rural endeavours to reach out and assist the poorest of poor through various health and development programmes based on the community needs and available manpower. While involved in such activities it also seeks to ensure that the values are preserved and self-development, in broader sense, of those involved in the work is achieved simultaneously. The focus of all programmes has been vulnerable members of family i.e. the women, children & elderly and the poor sections of society. In all the activities an attempt is made to incorporate as well as balance the three basic principles : Social Service, Scientific Approach and Spiritual Outlook. 100 bed hospital providing rational and quality medical care to the people of 1500 surrounding villages is one of our multifaceted activities. The Community Health Project provides timely and valuable care to pregnant women and new born babies of 2 primary health centers with population of about 50000 with new innovative mobile phone technology. Use of this technology is helping to reduce both newborn and maternal mortality rates effectively in project areas. Around 500 interested trainees in health subjects avail training during the year at our Health training Centre. Trainees included representatives from NGOs, State Govt. And students from India and abroad pursuing higher education. Comprehensive Eye Programme Provide ultramodern and intensive multi-speciality care to a population of around 15 lakhs. Over 800 permanently blind has been rehabilitated to lead Self dependent life after proper training by Community based rehabilitation programme. 100 poor rural and tribal students become gainfully employed after one year training at Vivekananda Gramin Tekniki Kendra. Various women related activities, economic, development & empowerment, which were done earlier under aegis of SEWA Rural, are being undertaken by an independent organisation Sharda Mahila Vikas Society since July 2002. Some of the achievements of SEWA Rural in last 3 decades include, successfully managing primary health center of Jhagadia for over 10 years achieving targets of Health for All by 2000 much earlier, manging First Referral Unit entrusted by Unicef & Govt. Of Gujarat and economic betterment of more than 2000 rural- tribal youth & women. The organisation believes in taking assistance from all sectors of civil society which includes local community, individual well-wishers and donors, voluntary organisations, Govt. & private industries, charitable trusts, academic institutions and foreign agencies. Their whole hearted support & encouragement have ensured that fruits of development & growth ultimately reach the marginalised and underserved sections of society i. e. women, tribals and the poor resulting in fulfilling most important mission of SEWA Rural i.e. reaching our the poorest of poor.
